sentences.en: Fashion is gentility running away from vulgarity, and afraid of being overtake.
sentences.cn: 时髦,是逃亡自庸俗而又惟恐被?上的假斯文.

sentences.en: Fashion is gentility running away from vulgarity, and afraid of being overtaken.
sentences.cn: 时髦,是逃亡自庸俗而又惟恐被赶上假斯文.
出身高贵,只不过是其祖辈有钱.

sentences.en: Gentility without ability is worse than plain beggary.
He spoke roughly in order to belie his air of gentility ( James Joyce )
sentences.cn: 为了给人有贵族气派的印象,他说话粗暴( 詹姆斯乔伊丝 )

sentences.en: He surrounds himself with all the trappings of gentility — dogs, horses, and fine paintings.
sentences.cn: 他身边满是象征高贵身份的东西——狗，马以及精美的画。

sentences.en: He swaggered out of the room, with much elegance and gentility.
sentences.cn: 他昂首阔步地从屋子里走出去, 气度雍容,姿态优美.

sentences.en: He thinks fine clothes are a mark of gentility.
sentences.cn: 他认为衣着讲究是身分高贵的标志.

sentences.en: He took her hand with discreet gentility.
sentences.cn: 他温文尔雅地牵着她的手。

sentences.en: His gentility is purely made up.
sentences.cn: 他的文雅都是装出来的.

sentences.en: It made Lydia wonder whether gentility might be a product of genetic engineering.
sentences.cn: 它使利迪娅考虑文雅是不是遗传工程的成果.

sentences.en: She conveys an aura of elegance and gentility.
sentences.cn: 她浑身散发着高贵典雅的气息.

sentences.en: The hotel had an air of discreet gentility.
sentences.cn: 这家酒店有一种不露痕迹的典雅气派。

sentences.en: The hotel has an air of faded gentility.
sentences.cn: 这家宾馆有一种没落的贵族氛围。

words.tran_cn: 有教养的，文雅的；上流社会的

trans.tran_cn: 高贵的地位[出身]，有风度，彬彬有礼，因循旧习
trans.tran_en: the quality of being polite, gentle, or graceful, and of seeming to belong to a high social class
